text: Ordered a selection of tacos, a burrito, beans and rice and tostadas for delivery. The tacos and burrito were very good. Beans and rice were too spicy for one of us to eat. Delivery, even though it is local, took long past the estimated time given. Yelp had to contact the restaurant after so much time had passed.

Food tastes ok. Better worth driving into Pilsen for better Mexican food. The portion of the Nachos are huge though.   The younger girls at the counter has attitudes. My boyfriend and I waited patiently to get seated and after 10 minutes of chatting to each other, one of the girl told us that we can sit anywhere...with an attitude! I don't mind the chatting but they could have made the effort to tell us to get seated rather than making us wait.  On top of that, I paid for cake to-go at the register when I paid for my dinner. The girl at the counter attended to other customers, while we waited 15 minutes for the cake as we stood there.  Talk about service. (￣^￣)

My boyfriend lives in Brighton Park and I live in the West Loop and this is the only taco place we go to. We've been coming here for about 5 years, either dining in or doing delivery for at least 1-2x/week. Sadly they don't deliver to the west loop anymore. Their tacos are consistently great. I've tried all their different types and there are no wrong choices. Even their tripas are good when you mention you'd like it well done. Service is also great and speedy. Parking is easy to find. Honestly no complaints, except please please please expand your delivery zone again.

There are several spots in the neighborhood for tacos but this one is my go-to. Authentic, inexpensive, simply good tacos. There's not much else to say about it. There's no ambience, which is probably why a lot of people I know prefer the place where all the cops go across from Freddie's. But the tacos here are far better. And they make fresh fruit smoothies. I've never had one, but worth mentioning.

So I came here today with my husband and I used to love this place but now I'm disappointed. I used to love their rice and beans but today I was so disappointed.  I had the taco dinner and since now they cook the beans with chili I cant have that anymore, since u can't take spicy food. So the food came and to my surprise the rice was undercooked. The tacos were good but can use more work.  My husband had the burrito and it was ok no surprise there. I loved their beans but like I said I can't eat spicy and it sucks i can't have those anymore.  The service was good, but the girl in the counter has some attitude problems, like girl chill. The two is for the fries that were decent.
Great local taco place. The al pastor on corn tacos are incredible. Love the huevos rancheros. Juke box comes on super loud every time I'm there

Awesome little Mexican restaurant. I ordered the green chicken enchilada plate and steak tacos for my husband. I ate off of the enchilada plate for 2 days, they give you so much food. My husband's steak tacos were delicious. Very inexpensive, we spent under $20, (thank you GrubHub for my 520% off coupon)
This is a good late night joint in Bridgeport b/c they stay open late. The food is pretty good & tastes authentic. Although I tend to order take out, the restaurant is a nice size with ample seating

I ordered delivery on a cold rainy evening. I ordered nachos which came hot crispy and delicious. Because of minimum order I Also ordered a burrito with Mexican sausage which I wasn't exactly sure was. I saved it for the next day. It was really good reheated. This will be my go to place from now on.

This is probably one of my favorite to go to spot for tacos around Bridgeport. Not too far from home and its located in a nice neighborhood. The staff is very kind and the service is also very fast! I ordered the taco dinner and the loaded nachos. It was just beyond filling that I even took it home and ate it the next day (it was still good.) You also get free chips and salsa dip as soon as you are seated and they also have seasoned carrots and peppers to eat with your meal. Their horchata is great! It is not too milky, or watery, and the cinnamon isnt overwhelmin either but can still taste the awesome flavorings.  I ordered the taco dinner (chose carne asada) and the plate comes with 3 tacos with everything on it (onions, cilantro, tomatoes) rice and beans. Very filling and definitely worth the $10. I definitely recommend anyone that was to grab a bite or is craving tacos. It is also BYOB and they are open past midnight! Free parking after 10 PM

Solid food, the first time I've been back since my college days a few years back. Normally we used to order the supreme nachos with alll the fixings way back when. Today we got the taco dinner (carne asada, al pastor, and lengua for me). Great flavor for the carne asada, al pastor, the lengua was a little bland but just add salt. Ask for the lengua extra crispy fried longer on their griddle. Decent portions, on par with lots of other Mexican food prices in Bridgeport. Came with rice and beans which were not the best but no complaints. Always get a large horchata it's delicious

This is one of my favorite spots I've found in the area for tacos. I've ordered delivery 4 times and every time they package everything where it's in a neat order. Food comes hot and always correct. I highly suggest giving them a try. Horchata is really good.

As a local this is one of my go to places and it's my first choice for Mexican in Bridgeport. It started just because it was open until 4am. But it blossomed into me not wanting anywhere else. Burritos,  tacos,  nachos,  enchiladas all have tasted great with any meat. Their horchata  is standard and tastes great,  and it's BYOB If you feel like having a brewski with your meal. They deliver, serve chips if you dine in, and accept credit cards if you spend over $10. The staff are good, being very standard servers. One time a friend brought a bottle of wine,  and they had to open a never used wine opener for us,  but they didn't mind.  If you're on the South Side,  and want great Mexican food,  look no further than San Jose Taqueria!
We ordered take out pretty close to closing, which is always a gamble. The food was fresh and delicious. My flautas were still super crunchy when the food arrived!

I've been here a couple of times. It's great how late they're open! I had a steak burrito the last time me, my fiancé, and daughter went and it was THE best burrito I've ever had. Their steak tacos are also amazing! The staff is extremely nice and laid back. Most definitely going back there, that's a given! I've also recommended to many of my family that if they're looking for some good Mexican food to check this place out!
I can't say enough good things about this place. Open late, great food, very friendly service, byob. Love it! Always taken care of here. Thank You!

Very greasy but this is not particularly a bad thing. The food is delicious. My favorites are their chicken enchiladas, anything al pastor (greasy but good), their pickled carrots peppers and onions, and that sugar milk from the gods HORCHATA!

Our constant go to place for tacos in the area. we usually do pick-up. They always get the order right  and the food is prepared quickly. Sometimes they get busy. They also open late.  The meats are pretty good. I usually get steak torta, shrimp ceviche tostada, taco dinner, horchata. I'm a big fan of the avocado on the shrimp tostada. The torta bread is toasted perfectly :) the rice is tasty. The sauces are good. They don't really disappoint. Good and convenient so we keep coming back.

Usually pretty standard mexican food. I just got some food from them today. I got the burrito suizo dinner. There was no ranchero sauce on it just melted cheese which is a bummer because if I knew they were gonna jip me I would have gotten a normal burrito which is 10 bucks, suizo is 12. I got al pastor and the meat was burnt and tough, it did not taste like al pastor at all. The rice it came with wasn't cooked all the way it was crunchy. I had to make sure I checked my bag this time because they always forget something, by time I get home I am to tired to go back. This time they forgot my zanahorias en escabeche. I support this place too much to be getting crap quality or missing items. I will most likely never return to this restaurant. Especially since 18th is much closer to me and there are tons of places to choose from.

They are really taking advantage of the gentrification in the area. They charge for every single thing now. It's a late night drunken food type. If you can go to Comales on 18th or Archer ave, go there instead! The carrots are almost always smelling fermented. Like they been prepared a long time ago and have been sitting at the bottom of the container.  Now they charge for them. You never know if they're going to be good until you get home and open them! The girl at the front was young and rude. They food takes forever!

This was my 1st time ordering from this place and it was not a very good experience! I did place the order through GrubHub and had it delivered. I had a missing item in my order so I placed a call to the restaurant. First person I spoke with was not very friendly, did not apologize for the mishap and just offered me a credit. I was also placed on hold multiple times as I was trying to explain that I wanted the amount refunded  to my card for the missing item. I was getting upset at this point. I called back to confirm that the item that was missing from my order was refunded to my card. The back round noise was so loud that the 2nd person I spoke with could barely hear me. Not a good 1st impression for a 1st time customer...

I'll agree with other reviewers on two things the service is hit or severely miss and the steak is not bomb.  However, the chicken and ground beef is amazing. The picadillo tacos are my fave. I also like he chips and guacamole. If I'm feeling cheap I'll get the chips and salsa - also bomb. The prices aren't too bad, either.  I always pick up my order since I live so close, so I can't speak for delivery service.

My go to Mexican restaurant in Bridgeport (and in general). It's interior is modest and nice for a late night, post drinking meal, but not much more. However, for what they lack in aesthetic, they make up for in food. Whether it's Tacos, fried quesadillas, nachos, tostadas, etc., it's all fantastic. Greasy and flavorful, they don't skimp on portion sizes. This can make some of their meals messy, but it's worth it. To top it all off, they have an excellent horchata to wash it all down.  Prices are cheap to reasonable, depending on what you want, but I almost always have leftovers.  I've introduced many of my friends to this restaurant and all of them have had nothing but good things to say. So if you're in the area stop in stop in for a meal or get delivery. I've never had to wait longer than 45 minutes whether it's just for me or larger group orders.
Come and support these mom and pops...my new favorite spot for some delicious steak tacos and chicken tostado...love this small joint!!!

My boyfriend, roommate, and I have frequently ordered from this place consistently for the past year and a half. We ordered a torta, tostadas, tacos, and horchata from them. The delivery guy gave us our food, but without the horchata so we called the delivery guy, but he didnt pick up. Of course, we called the restaurant directly and told them our situation.  The woman who picked up the phone said that she would speak to the manager and call us back. After 20 minutes of not hearing from them, we called again and the same woman picked up the phone. She said the delivery guy gave us the horchata and did not believe us when we said we didn't get it. They even said they would send another one if we paid for delivery. But we didnt even receive it in the first place. We told them that this was ridiculous and her words were "yeah this is ridiculous because you got two bags." Yea, she pretty much told us we were liars. The delivery guy will probably just find the horchata in the car, drink it, and hide it. Never felt so unfair and never ordering here ever ever again!! All i wanted was the horchata that i paid and ordered for. :( Tl;dr, TERRIBLE customer service. Find a different taco place that gives you your horchata!

I would give the food four stars, but the customer service zero or a negative amount if that was an option. I ordered from here a few times until they messed up multiple parts of my order. I ordered their nachos and they have just basic nachos and ones that have more toppings. I also wanted cheese on my vegetarian tacos. I called over the phone and specifically asked the girl working if they came with cheese. She told me yes but then realized she was wrong. I had said many times I will pay extra if necessary but I don't like them without cheese but she insisted since she made the mistake the cheese would be free. Well how nice of her. ...except when I received my food a lot of the toppings were missing, including the cheese on my tacos and every item was wrong. I figured I'd call and they'd simply replace anything they had messed up. Wrong again. I spoke to a manager who proceeded to say he'd bring the toppings only and only if I paid extra for the cheese. What? First of all, the food would get cold by then. Any self-respecting restaurant would replace the wrongly made items. So I ended up on the phone with this guy for a half hour while he told me how replacing my food was not in his power. I got so frustrated I threatened to wheel my butt down there (because I was in a wheelchair at the time) to complain and if I had to I'd call an authority or my bank to have them forced to refund us. He kept insisting his chef would never make so many mistakes, but he definitely did. It was at this point that he finally called the store owner and agreed to replace the food as long as we hadn't eaten it yet. Problem solved, but not without extreme frustration and the decision to never purchase anything from here again and to inform my friends and family to do the same. Oh and I hadn't even noticed the missing guacamole on my nachos till way later but it wasn't worth the oxygen.

I waited over an hour for my food and finally gave them a called. The receptionist was very rude and told me to call eat 24. I tried calling Eat24 but they never pick up. Next I called the restaurant back and she hang up on me! Do not come here.

This place is hit and miss. You might have good service if you go on a night when the more mature gals are working. Some nights the service is questionable (as in, how is this place operating?). As far as ordering through a delivery/pickup service.. There always seems to be some chaos. The food is great but you have to know what to order. Chicken anything is delicious here! The nachos, burritos, enchiladas... I read another review that said it was dry and as many times as we've been here never experienced that. No "vegan" choices but you can make almost anything vegetarian. They also serve fresh juice at a great price but only a few folks know how to clean and operate it.
The food was flavorful and tasty and it was a sizable order that's the reason why I always come here they also have real fruit drinks

Typical taqueria. Our intention was to hit Nana at the corner but it was a Tuesday and they were closed. We had already paid for street parking so let's make it count.  Stepped into San Jose and sat ourselves. It was clean enough, not very busy, and the waitress hooked us up with some fresh chips and a pretty bland red salsa. We put our orders in, steak burrito dinner (no lettuce please) and wifey ordered tacos. Our food arrived a short time later... A couple things about my burrito. 1) DO NOT CUT MY BURRITO IN-HALF. I'm a big boy and should I not be able to handle it, I'll have my wife cut it in-half for me. 2) I'M DINING IN YOUR RESTAURANT - NO NEED TO TIGHTLY WRAP MY BURRITO IN FOIL. I get it... If I were taking my burrito for a walk, this would make perfect sense - However, I'm sitting at a table and it just looks stupid for a burrito to show up wearing foil for a sit-down dinner. Once I undressed the burrito I realized it was oozing refried beans like everywhere. It was a HOT mess. I grabbed my first bite of it's steamy goodness but came up empty for anything remotely textured as steak in mi boca. Tasted fine so I went for the next bite...  Again, no real subsistence or steakiness to it. I finished up and was left feeling robbed of steak. I think it was in there because I tasted it - However, the seem to pulverize the steak to a point where someone with no teeth would be able to suck it down a straw (in combination with the fact that the burrito was tooooo OVER-BEANED). None the less, they do not steak burrito very well here. I would think they're trying to cut corners and save money - I never really saw a piece of steak fall from my burrito, just mushy beans dripping out.  My wife's stated her tacos al pastor were average but nothing to get giddy over.   We probably won't return to San Jose... until I'm 85 and can no longer chew my own steak.  Clean place and friendly service earned them 2 stars.

I haven't been to the restaurant but we do order from here. Here are the highlights: AMAZING carne asada tacos. They have so much meat in them we really enjoy them The salsas are really delicious The price isn't too bad considering the amount of food you get The delivery has been early each time The not so good: The chips weren't very good, although we did enjoy the salsa The guacamole was very thin and felt like it was more of a liquid sauce than the usual guacamole The pastor tacos were okay, but not great We'll definitely be ordering from here again.

Don't waste you time or money! First of all it took 20 mins until me and my 3 friends to get a cup of water, mind you it was not busy at all and we had to ask the waitess for a glass a water. Then they get our order wrong and when my friend told them that she did not want cheese on her torta or beans the lady simply scrapped off the cheese and handed the plate right back to her. The only positive was their Jamaica agua but we will not being coming back.

Way to go, Indian waiter who works there illegally and the waitress on duty Saturday night for giggling at me and then offending me by asking my age. You guys should be ashamed of yourself for not having been taught something about customer service. I was uncomfortable throughout sitting there watching them giggle as I was alone, on phone, speaking to a friend about her serious issues. I used to come to this restaurant because Bronzeville is where my journey started in Chicago 3 years ago and this Taqueria was the first restaurant I ever visited. They had a fabulous, dedicated manager back then. Where is she????? I moved elsewhere but I made it a point to stop by whenever I am passing by the area, and no, not for the food because it's become really trashy and hurts your stomach -- I went there for the Tres Leches cake which they order from outside. This was my last time. Shame on you both weirdos.

Very good food and they really do give you a lot! I enjoy that unlike most places they give you not only salsa but also an array of spicy pickled vegetables. I also enjoyed the steak burrito. service was good and they are open pretty late too which is nice! But for the third time in a row my order was wrong or something was missing....

I always come here! Literally always. I don't know why I've never checked in. This place is amazing. The food here is very good especially the tacos. I will definitely be checking in more often ( I should have at least 15 check ins here LOL).

I like this place - good steak tacos. But every time I order off grub hub they screw up my order. The first time, they left out one dinner all together, and the second time they actually have my order to someone else. I came in to get my food and they said "you just came in to get it?" Obviously my presence there showed that I did not come to get it... So I had to sit and wait for them to remake the whole order . Also, it scares me that they have health code violations..
Mediocre, expensive ($5.00 delivery charge??),skimpy with their asada. I've had better, real Mexican food and Horchata.  Disappointed. Never ordering from here again.

Food is good but the service is horrible. Placed an order and waited over an hour until I decided to call them and find out that they didn't bother to make the food even when I had already pre paid for it.  Then I get told that it was now too late to deliver.

So the one time I decide to order delivery online I had the worst experience. Ordered around 10:20pm and waited past the 45 min-60 min wait time. Attempted to call the restaurant several times only to hear a busy tone on the other end. Contacted Yelp to get a update and they told me to wait another 10 mins. 20 mins later the food Finally arrives. While I finally got my order. It was missing my drink item it was a little upsetting after waiting almost an hour and a half. The food was mediocre. Have had better authentic Mexican at other spots.  Ordered 4 tacos  Intestine was bland Ground beef and pork were the only tacos to taste decent And chicken taco tasted really dry Also ordered a steak burrito with intestines for my girlfriend and she only ate half and said it was mediocre.  Ordered a horchata as well but they forgot that.  Side note: been about 40 mins since I ate the food and my stomach is bubbling now.. Sorry but I will not be ordering here ever again.  I distinctly remember the food being better in the past.

I just ordered a taco dinner from here. For a  taco dinner and delivery was $16.00. The food came cold, and they poured hot sauce all over the food when I got it. I do not like hot sauce. The meat was sub par, and didnt have any flavor to it, and came cold. I was not happy with their food and would never order from them again. There delivery charge was 3.50 which i think is very high when most places are $2.00.

Overall, not good.  Homemade chips were good.  Guacamole had too much lime and really no avocado flavor.  Queso fundido was oily as hell to the point where it almost instantly separated.  Tostadas showed potential.  Shells weren't doubled, and the grease saturated the single shell they provided quickly, too gross to even bother with.  I had no choice but to scrape all of the toppings off, tossing the tomato that I specifically requested they not include in the first place.  Asada and pastor had great flavor but the heaping pile I was left to eat them from left little to be desired visually.   The chilies rellanos tacos were a mistake, but for reasons I can't even begin to understand for such a straight forward dish.  Salsa was unmemorable.  Take a pass.
Food is amazing. The burrito is one of the best I've had. The tacos are pretty good too. I would highly recommend getting the tres leches cake on the side.  Staff is very friendly.

It took over 1 hour and 20 minutes to receive our order. I even watched while the driver struggled, with what it appeared to be over 15 orders, to find our order. The food was more than cold; it was almost like taken out of the refrigerator. After we spent several minutes warning up our food, the taste was not even good, nor appropriate for a restaurant. If I wanted to have this kind of experience, I would have gone to a supermarket and grab something from the frozen food section. My advise, if you have a choice, dio not even think about ordering delivery from this people. I know, I will never order delivery again from them. Yes, the driver was educated and perhaps the experience at the restaurant may be better; but, delivery is horrible no matter how you look at it. Sad, very sad. I'm glad I don't own this restaurant.

This was myFirst time trying this place, and i went thru yelp. My first experience was good. I tried the steak tacos & chicken tacos, with steak & chicken flantas. They both were good, but I enjoyed the chicken tacos & chicken flantas, because it had more flavor. There guacamole & chips was a perfect taste as well. They close late & will go again.

We dropped by here one late night after a recommendation from a friend to fill a mexican craving. This was located in Bridgeport Chicago and parking was pretty easy to find. The Mexican food was delicious and authentic. They were super busy even on a late night and their service was mediocre. They were very busy with just takeout. Would return again!
The rice had Lima beans in it. Kinda odd. Everything else was just alright, nothing special.

So I got take out from this place the other day when I was too lazy to make lunch. I got an order of the nachos and they were out of this world. Steak, Jalapeños, Sour cream. I got it to go and it was good. Do you know how hard it is to get Nachos to go and have them still be good?? I also had a steak taco which was great. I will definitely be going back and dining in

Their chips and salsa are to die for!!! I absolutely love their tacos, burritos, and horchata. The only thing that I dislike about this place is that they have a credit/debit minimum, but overall, this is the only place that I go to for Mexican food. Nothing can compare to the way they flavor and season their meat. Open later hours is a plus for times when its midnight and you don't want to cook and your stomach is grumbling.

I ordered for delivery around dinner time. It took forever to arrive( around an hour) and when the food got here it was cold. I ordered several tacos (al pastor and steak) and they were soggy and just not very tasty anyways. In addition, i ordered a tostada de ceviche de camaron and it's supposed to be ceviche. I've ordered this before and it was something totally different. what i got was a gross mass of sour cream, lettuce, and plain shrimp. Also from my experiences prior to this one, i always ordered for pickup at least 15 minutes before. A lot of the times i would get there and I would have to wait another 10 minutes. What's the point of me ordering over the phone then? I will never come here again. There are better places than this.
It wasn't good bad we had the tacos. I had the al pastor and chicken taco. I think their fair.

I would love to give San Jose five stars... but their service is terrible. Pick-up and delivery definitely take priority (this would probably be the way to go if you want to try their food), but if you choose to dine-in, be prepared to wait way too long for your food. The wait staff is inattentive and sometimes rude, and your order may even be forgotten.  My last visit was surprisingly less accommodating than any other. The madness of deliveries and pick-up orders toward the front of the restaurant was unpleasant and actually distracted my waitress enough to leave my food waiting at the counter for about ten minutes (we had already been waiting 30+ minutes after ordering). My chicken fajita (usually to die for) had burnt onto the sizzling pan because it didn't get to my table in time for me to stir it up a bit. The two previous times I had ordered this dish, the serving size was double the amount, not burnt, and was served with a side of beans, rice, lettuce and some avocado. This time, though, the serving was pretty skimpy, burnt, and only served with the beans and rice (which are consistently amazing). When I asked the waitress about the lettuce and avocado, she just kept saying "Extra, it's extra," as if I was bothering her (probably from taking her away from figuring out what the heck was happening with the deliveries).  Needless to say, I only tipped about 5% this visit. Although the food was abnormally horrible, it's usually fantastic and definitely worth the lack of service this place has to offer. I won't give up on it yet.
The food was good but I didn't get my tres leche when I ordered and I paid for everything before it was delivered
Best burritos in Bridgeport! Love the vegetarian burrito and milkshakes.

It's pretty much become my go to mexican place, granted i did just move literally 1 block away, but it's good and quick and cheap, i usually just get one (or many) of their $2 tacos, ive had tripe, lengua, chorizo, carne asada and pastor, all good, and perfect for a quick snack, and also the chicken quesadilla is very good, and its BYOB! tho i havent had time to eat there yet, also the horchata wasnt bad either, im sure i will be returning often in the future!

I came here and ordered 3 tongue taco dinner. The tongue had no flavor, no taste. It was like I was eating just the tortilla. My friend had the steak tacos which were better. If you come here, stay away from the tongue tacos.

Pizza or Mexican?  That's always the question, isn't it?!?! Well, let me just start with this I LOVE FOOD AND FOOD LOVES ME. I am a constant YELPER when it comes to trying new food. Running around hungry after the NLC-National FBLA conference award ceremony tonight I figured what would be open at 10:30 PM?  I looked on YELP and remembered that I had bookmarked a Mexican Restaurant due to the reviews. When I called and asked if they delivered to the Hyatt Regency McCormick she checked with someone and affirmed that they did. She was very very helpful and knowledgable of the food items. She then made a few suggestions based on my food restrictions (no shellfish or red meat), just cheese and chicken. She quickly accommodated me with one of the cheese filled potato MASA quesadillas and a chicken tostada which were  bomb.com  insanely delicious!  Now you have to understand something...I am from California and I am VERY spoiled with my mother's Argentine cuisine and the local Mexican restaurant where I live. Like I said I know food, so you can understand when I say food is good here I mean it is OUTSTANDING! The pico de gallo and guacamole were like no other Mexican restaurant I have ever been to. CHUNKY AND FRESH!! By the time I got to the lobby the driver was there at the concierge desk--he was quick concise and to the point. It was very nice. I've been to quite a few cities-- London, Buenos Aires, and San Francisco--and I can say that I truly love Chicago for visiting this first time and this restaurant added the cherry on the top!   Take my advice go for the Mexican if you're debating and forget about the pizza! Oh, all of it including tip and the BEST horchata I have ever had was $25.00. Can't speak for the dine in experience but man, this place ROCKS! See you soon, Taquería José!

The food at this restaurant is about average.  My family ordered dinner through  grubhub.com . My husband wanted a burrito suizo but we did not get any sauce with his order. I ordered a chocolate shake but the restaurant put cinnamon on top. I wish I would have known prior to ordering the shake, I would have opt-out on the cinnamon. Basically I am saying all of the menu items do not have details. However my steak torta was delicious. It would have been even better if it was not a little soggy around the edges.

Late night food fare, tasty and filling just the way I like it. I didn't find it to be greasy as some people reviewed. I was very nervous after reading reviews. It was late and we had already sat down. It was priced pretty decently and I left very full. The waitress was very nice and very attentive. I think the only issue we had was that it was roasting like a fire put in there!! The waitress was roasting too and kept apologizing!

This is my go to Mexican place for home delivery. Their shrimp fajitas are delicious! My dine in experience wasn't so great. It was cinco de mayo and there was a ton of delivery orders it was hard to get the attention of the staff although there were only 2 other tables with customers.
Super nachos with steak are tasteless. The chicken quesadilla is flavorful. Wish I would have just gotten the quesadilla.

Worst service ever. They're so unorganized. I called for a pickup order for a couple tacos. I waited 15 minutes to leave my house. When I got there I still had to wait 15 minutes. It takes a half hour to make two tacos?? If it wasn't so late I would've gone somewhere else. And when you get there, they act like they don't know what you're talking about when you say you have a pickup order. Horrible service and their bathroom was disgusting the last time I went there.

The food was just ok.  The service was slow and pretty inattentive. Major points off for having a TV on broadcasting garbage talk shows. Isn't there a soccer game on somewhere in the world?  Did I go to San Jose on one of its off days??  Honestly, thought Taqueria Mexicana was so much better in terms of service and ambience--which isn't really saying a lot.

Dined here a couple times and ordered the chilequiles with chicken and green sauce at the first visit and steak tacos at the next. The chilequiles weren't the best I've had but they were still very good and very filling. The serving was huge! The steak tacos were very tasty and you could tell that the steak had been marinated very well. I love a Mexican restaurant that has pickled carrots and cauliflower in a big container right beside you. I've also tried one of their juices; I forgot which one it was, but it was very good and fresh. For cheap and delicious Mexican cuisine that's open late night, go to Taqueria San Jose!

i've ordered with them 3 times and each time there was some odd shenanigan with the order process. first time I was far outside the delivery zone (was notified after I processed the order) and I would need to give the driver an additional tip, second time same thing but they didnt require the delivery premium, the third time and last time I ever order from them, the order didnt come at all, I called the restaurant an hour and thirty minutes after ordering food to find out that my order was marked as delivered. TSJ reached out to the driver and said the food was delirvered to a woman (not a woman) and that there was nothing that could be done about it. I contacted the web portal I ordered with (eat24) and they refunded me my money because TSJ refused to do anything more that give me the drivers number (wtf?) so I could speak with the driver about who he gave my food to (again, wtf?) I will never, ever order from there and I would recommend no one else either unless you like receiving terrible service.

I ordered through GrubHub two days in a row and I promise it was like night and day!!!! I ordered the Shrimp and Garlic and Guacomole the first day and the shrimp was flavorful and had plenty of sauteed onions, garlic, and peppers. DELICIOUS! The guacomole was creamy and had lots of flavor. However, on the second order of the same entree, there was no sign of onions, garlic, or bell peppers in the shrimp although it was flavored. The real disappointment was the guacamole. There was SOOOO much onion that you would have thought I had ordered onion dip with a side of avocado and there absolutely no flavor. There must be two different chefs so I have to catch the right chef or I won't be ordering again. I really enjoyed my first experience but the second prder really soured my overall experience.

I'm giving this place 5 stars for a few reasons. They have your typical run of the mill food, buuuuuuut they also have some unique items. The masa quesadillas are something I've never seen before, simply delicious and inventive. Even better that they are made fresh and you can choose your filling. As a vegetarian, I'm always looking for Mexican restaurants to go beyond the zucchini taco. This place has potatoes, rajas and a few other things. They also have a fantastic juice bar and desserts. Will definitely come back.

The food is delicious and very authentic. I have tried the ceviche tostada, the guacamole, the tacos. Their portions are pretty big. They also squeeze fresh juice. I've tried the strawberry one and it was refreshing. The service is very slow though. You'll be waiting for 45 to an hour for your food. Don't be expecting a short lunch break.

This place is so cheap and has great food. I went here today for a quick bite. They were fast and tasty. I got three pastor tacos and guac and chips. It costed $11.70. So much food. My girlfriend and I split it all and were full for hours. Granted this isnt my favorite mexican place but it is a great pit stop if you are in the Bridgeport area [and looking to save some coin].

Pros: Cheap, open late, nice staff, online ordering Cons: Lackluster food. The vegetarian burrito was basically a tortilla filled with bland rice. The interior has an interesting and slightly unpleasant aroma like mildew. Maybe it's due to growing up on the west coast and living in Arizona for a few years but I'd call this mediocre Mexican at best.

I ordered delivery.took a little while cause driver got lost but staff was very sweet. Food was very traditional mexican. Was great and glad I gave them a try.chicken flautas were perfect.beans a little salty but very creamy.u get pickled mexican veggies with each order as well.
Outstanding authentic food and service. Veronica and the rest of the staff were very gracious to our party of 5. Highly recommend.

Since I've  been on an Al pastor binge I read the reviews and wondered what was up...I read the good and bad reviews and I try to disregard the bad to still try it. Ordered 3 al pastor tacos with cilantro onions lettuce and tomato by far the greasiest Al pastor I've tried so far AND there also was a bug crawling around in my food (like a fruit fly or gnat) the two bites I ate before the bug citing was pretty decent but the bug threw everything off  Prolly won't go back

Customer service is the best that's why I gave the stars, my husband loved the steak super nacho, but my chicken taco salad was not good at all. I absolutely hate shredded chicken with bell peppers as an entree, meal just becomes soggy with broth. Yuck! The servers are the best though;)
Love It!!! They have great customer service, friendly delivery guys, and all around great Mexican food. There are not many words except, Try it, you'll love it!!
Cheap eats; huge portions. It will take you a week to finish the super nachos.

I do not like the fact that I've had to ask for water and chips and salsa because the server was negligent. I love jalapeños and carrots but unfortunately they serve soft, less fresh ones here. I really dislike the chicken tacos- the meat did not have much flavor. It's always annoying having to wave down the server because my table was my checked on. I gave it 2 stars because I like that they offer fresh juice on the menu, and I also like its 24 hours and BYOB

Went here at 2 am after a few drinks. I ordered just one al pastor taco with cilantro and onion because of the generous offering of chips and dip upon dining in. Don't think the waitress/cashier was too happy about that. Given my tiny order, service wasn't exceptionally prompt. Everything was drenched in oil, especially the tortilla and chips. However, the taco filling was delicious and fresh tasting, though greasy as well. What can you expect for $2... Bottom line: great prices, not so great food, and I won't be returning unless I've had a few.
This is a good p lace to go if you are drunk and want to get drunker because you can byob here.  Have had much better Mexican Food .  It is always way to hot in there also.
The chips served during table service are legit. Fresh, tasty, and the salsa is on point as well. Really loved the tacos, reliably tasty food. And super cheap. No complaints at all.

Cheap and yummy. Steak Burrito was a bit greasy from the meat, but tasted great. I also got some tacos..lettuce, onion, cilantro and meat. Just how I like it! About $1.60 each? (I forgot). Friendly staff

I'd say that there are many better places to go for Mexican food, but my stars are for the fresh juice.  Pressed on order, choose one of their combos or make your own.  Very tasty.  Staff is very nice, too.

Excellent mexican food, was starving after the White Sox opener went here and ate like a king, I had the steak taco dinner which came with brown rice and beans, my two drinking partners both got steak burritos, which they didn't complain about at all..will be back again...drunk I'm sure leaving a White Sox game.
Tacos, guacamole and tortilla chips are amazing.  Love the lemonade!  You can not go wrong if your looking for great tacos; chicken and beef

Simple Mexican goodness. Steak nachos have been a favorite for years. Al Pastor tacos are my newest addition to an order. Take out is quick & easy and ladies working are awesome & friendly. Now take debit/credit over $15.

first of all I cannot go 5 stars. That would be the best Mexican restaurant around.  2nd I can not go 4 because I feel this place can be better. I do love the burritos.  Good size, steak is cooked well.  But when I ask for one with extra veggies they never seem to understand what that means.  Extra lettuce and tomato ect ect...  They seem to always give me extra meat. For some people that's not a complaint.  But not this guy, sorry.

This is my go-to for delicious Mexican food. The food is absolutely delicious (and greasy) with massive portions. HOWEVER, I have never had good service here. You practically have to beg for a refill and the waitresses don't even seem to like any of the customers.  Last time I was there I was asked to get up and pay for my meal right after I started eating. I wouldn't normally have a problem with this, but my waitress interrupted our conversation to ask us to pay. 5 star food, 2 star (at best) service. For a really long time I've been assuming that the waitresses are having an off day, but considering I've probably eaten here 15+ times, I just don't think that's the case.

My absolute favorite thing here is the al pastor tacos. So good.  The prices are great and the horchata is huge and tasty. My husband and I often (ok, always) order the nachos especiales with carne asada. It is so unhealthy but so tasty. I don't think I have ever had anything here that I didn't like. Ok, maybe not the torta--the bread seems like a very stale jumbo hamburger bun, and I've had it several times. But it's not inedible, I've just had better.  The table service is just ok but I don't normally have high expectations for places where you have to walk to the register to pay. Basically, I love this place. Al Pastor!
Little pricey I think and did non not have updated menu

I highly recommend this restaurant. It's inexpensive but very fresh, clean and friendly. The chips and guacamole are unparalleled. The steak tacos are so delicious it's hard not to order seconds. The staff is really friendly and they can customize everything according to your tastes. Bueno!

Great place for delicious and inexpensive Mexican! They are open late, it's BYOB the staff is very cool and pleasant and always helpful.  With tacos you get a choice of onions and cilantro, or tomatoes and lettuce,  and they come with complimentary carrots and 2 kinds of hot sauces, the verde is my favorite!  The meat that I've had (chicken, steak and pork) has always been tender juicy nicely seasoned and none of the nasty fatty chewy parts that sometime find their way into your 2am tacos at other joints. Maybe I've just been lucky, but then I'm really lucky because I've found myself here a lot in last five years!  Great smoothies too!

I love Taqueria San Jose. As a college student, this is definitive as the neighborhood grease spoon that's open late. The four of us go in and share the nachos supreme (I'm not sure if this is the name exactly) and it is a giant plate. Delicious, unhealthy, and basically cheese, beans, carne asada (choose your meat, I recommend the steak though!) on top of their homemade tortilla chips. I love their salsas that they keep in easy squeeze bottles on the table. The horchata is plentiful and vey reasonably priced. I've had the torta, which was only okay.
LOVE IT! This place is cheap and delicious. The service is great and the portions are GIGANTIC!! If you like inexpensive Mexican cuisine, I cannot recommend this place highly enough.

I absolutely LOVE this place. It's really close to my home and they are open late which is convenient when I have late night cravings for Mexican food. The staff is always super friendly and the food is ready within 15 min or less. If you haven't tried already what are you waiting for?

Random stop the other night while walking bars in the area.  Many of their late night patrons were also at the bars nearby.  It took about twenty minutes waiting on ordered burritos.  Two in hand and they were heavy!  In a drunken state, the burritos were pretty good.  The following day my cousin texts to tell me the burrito was excellent.  I wasn't as sure but you see my cousin (is the type that) doesn't believe there is a such thing as bad pizza.  If I say it's cardboard with cheese, he says it was okay.
If you are looking for some cheap Delicious Mexican food than look further. The portions are huge, the food is cooked just right and the staff is quite nice.
I wish I could give t his place 10 stars. The mother & the daughter of this place are super sweet. Tacos are bomb! They are quick, cheap & filling.

This place is cheap and located very close to my house. The food is good. Service is great and the waitress are friendly. Come here for the burrito and horchata, plus this place is open late!  There large horchata are huge! Great place to get a Rumchata party started!

This place is cool. I been here several times. It's not the best quality ingredients and the meat is usually fatty. But the food is always consistent and available, with good seasoning. They are always my go to Mexican place when I don't want to travel any further to Pilsen or the Little Village.  The horchata here is yummy. And the fruit/vege drinks are fresh and yummy!!
I like the ground beef tacos here with cilantro and onions, very tasty :)
DELICIOUS food at reasonable prices, clean bathrooms even at late night/prime bar time, open late and a pretty and clean restaurant. What more could you want in a late night restaurant?

What do you do when you and your kids are hungry and craving tacos at 10pm!?! You call this place! We were wanting tacos and most places that were open were either over priced or didn't sell individual tacos. My little ones can't eat a whole platter by themselves. So I used my trusty Yelp app and found this place. Open until 2am, and serving individual tacos at a reasonable price. I honestly didn't expect much but boy was I surprised. First we paid $15 for 6 tacos, an order of rice and beans and a large horchata. I decided to take a bite of the chicken taco first and it was the most seasoned soft chicken taco I'd had ever eaten. The green salsa was also delicious! I really loved that they put in carrots and jalapeños in vinagre. Those were equally amazing. I have every intention of coming here on a regular basis. ;)

Went here late one night, just expecting a drunken burrito fix, but it ended up being so much more! The burritos were delicious, and the guacamole was the best restaurant guacamole I've had in the city, no exaggeration. The house-made chips were PERFECT as well. Not too thick, and fried at just the right temperature to get flaky and not greasy. Well done, San Jose. ***returned about a month later, not on a drunken burrito spree, and the guacamole was still absolutely delicious, and I really enjoyed my vegetarian burrito, which, as many vegetarians know, can be hit or miss. I'll be back!
Service was fine, very friendly and prompt, but their tacos are ok. I've had much better tacos from the back of a grocery store, but it wasn't bad, mediocre at best.

Ordered for delivery and they got our address wrong. It came 45 mins later total (we live 5 blocks away & could've gotten it ourselves).  We ordered burritos (carne asada), basically we were eating a cold, soggy burrito. But the portion was good for the price we paid for.

I hope I don't start ranting because I am so annoyed right now. Okay, I ordered three vegetarian tacos, no rice and I asked if they had the thinly shredded white Mexican cheese, I told them I didn't know it's proper name but where I've gotten it before that's what they call it and I gave them an extremely detailed description.  There was no language barrier because this girl speaks English just as well as me! She tried to put some like...nacho cheese type crap on my taco but thankfully I came in and showed the other waitress what I wanted and she fixed it. This was a call in order BTW. I'm so annoyed I'm telling this out of order.  Okay back to the taco itself, after I placed the order I realized she didn't specify if the taco was hard shell or not and I despise soft shell tacos so I called back like 8 minutes later. I asked were they hard shell or not and she said, "They're soft shell like you asked for." *death glare* I hate when people tell me I said something I know I did not say.  I hate soft shell tacos and I would never order a GD soft shell taco. Anyway, so I'm like, "Um, no I did not say SOFT SHELL, I said taco, but I didn't specify and you didn't ask. Are they made already?? She says yeah, and since I'm such a nice person I said, "Well, I'll pay for them since they're made already but I don't want them because I don't eat soft shell tacos and I have no one to give them to. I want to order and additional order of HARD SHELL TACOS."  *out of order due to anger* Also, I ordered salsa of which I got three prices for, the first person said it was $2.50 the second person said it was free and the third person said it was 3.30 so I have no idea how much this mystery salsa is. I really try not to argue with people that are making my food because we all know what happens when you argue with them, that's half of the reason I agreed to pay for the tacos I WASN'T GOING TO TAKE.  So I get there, we go through the cheese thing, she says to the other lady, "No she said the queso *somethinginspanish* and I'm standing there like...........alright now....with that "she said" crap. So she comes up with my order, in the smallest bag, with this extremely small package in it and I'm like.......maybe they wrap it tight? So my order comes out to $15.07. I'm thinking... hmm... 15? Well, I'll check it out when I get home... This whole ordeal took about 40 minutes and now I'm sure that first batch of tacos wasn't even ready because I stood in there waiting on the second batch for like 15 minutes. So I'm ready to gtfo of there. I go home, open my tacos, no they are not tightly wrapped. They are the smallest baby tacos I have ever seen in my life. I ate the first two so fast if I hadn't taken the picture for Yelp before I ate them I would have sworn I only had two.  So I'm stewing in this anger now, I'm looking through my wallet for the receipt and I'm like.....*eye roll* Where TF is it?! So I call them and ask and she's like, "Oh we don't give out receipts, we need them for the books at the end of the day"....I am trying so hard not to swear in this review but what in the actual F-word?! You don't "give out" receipts?!  So I explain and she's adding it up and she's like, "Your total should've been around $12.60" and I'm like "Yeah...........but it was $15.07" So she says she'll call the manager and call me back. So she calls back *shocker* and the manager confirms this price. She said I was charged .35 cent for cheese per taco *Even the three I didn't get*....the .35 cent I did not know about until hours later because I would have never ordered them in the first place. So we add it up and it does come out to $15 dollars if the salsa was 3.30....... but then she says "Yeah...the salsa is free but you paid for chips"...... I didn't even fu***** get chips. I like to eat the salsa with my own chips "Doritoes". I couldn't stay on the phone with her anymore so I hung up. I'm going in there tomorrow and somebody better explain to me why I paid $15.07.

Service sucks, food sucks, and yeah the service sucks. I have both dinned in and ordered out and again, the service and food both suck. I gave San Jose multiple chances to redeem itself but Nada!!  I am not sure if they are under new management but I was not impressed and I use to order from here ALOT. Needless to say, I will not be back!

HUGE portions, especially for the price.  I ordered the carne asada burrito with cheese and my boyfriend got the nachos.  We both had crazy amounts of leftovers and left the place uncomfortably full.   BYOB is pretty awesome.  But honestly, their horchata was better than the beer we brought.  I almost got some to bring home with me so I could have it the next day with my leftovers. Also, great service.

I've definitely experienced better.  Decent place in the hood to get a taco and cheap.  The service is under-whelming and they were watching "Fast & the Furious 5" in the dining room.  The opening scene has a fecal explosion in a bathroom.  Not too appetizing when you are about to fork down re-fried beans.

Taqueria San Jose....I wanted so much to give you a good review, but I really can't. On the positive side, when the food is good it's super good. But it's only ever good about half the time. Then the girls on the phone when you call in are hard to understand and regularly leave you on hold for an extended period of time.  Granted, this is a dive-ish taco place, and I shouldn't be expecting stellar service and that was fine when the food quality made up for it, but it doesn't anymore.
Great food! Simple & easy & convenient! Love the tacos & al pastor gorditas. They deliver too.
The best spot I the barrio I'll never go to that Atrendia or what ever that other restaurant. Tacos de pastor is the stuff and torts de milensa

This was my 1st and last time eating their food. Tried a steak and a chicken taco. The steak tasted like hamburger meat and the chicken was just OK. The size of the tacos was absolutely ridiculous. Little baby tacos. What a ripoff. Apparently, they use the smallest taco shells known to mankind. Never again. Buh-bye!

GREAT FOOD! I always get the Tostadas. They come with a heaping amount of meat, sour cream, avocado, and tomato.  They are open late, the service is very fast, and friendly.  Again, food is very tasty.

This is a neighborhood joint that is convenient because it's open late. I've eaten here several times and the experience has been alright. Except for the time I found a piece of hair in my steak torta. I showed it to the waitress and she didn't see it. I kept on pointing to it and she just gave up and she would get me a new one.  I don't think it was an entirely FRESH new one, but I couldn't find anything else in my food.

This is my go to neighborhood spot down in Bridgeport. It's a late night spot where you can walk in sit down and relax. The menu is really straight-forward for a Tanqueria tacos, burritos, tostadas, and tortas. Friendly staff, clean place, quick service, and BYOB. The food isn't going to win any awards but it shouldn't. This place  has a purpose and it serves that purpose well.

DoIt is what it is, a grea late night Mexican food restaurant. You can sit down and relax. The staff is amazing. They are friendly and patient with every drunken fool that walks through their door. BYOB too!

Yummy, yummy, yummy.  I was in a mood for Mexican take out and based on Yelp reviews, I had to come here.  We ordered the chicken torta dinner.  I was in heaven.  I loved the beans, the rice, and the torta.  I will definitely go back when I get a feel for ethnic Mexican food... mmmmmmmm

This place is amazing! I make weekly visits there and I'm never disappointed. The tacos de al pastor are great (could use pina), the asada nachos are super delish and the lastly the tostadas are so loaded you only need 1! I really hope this place never changes for the worse like comales (the prices went up and the quality went down). I have no complaints and the food is usually ready 7mins after you place your order. And I can't forget the best part its BYOB and I dont think there is a corkage fee. Enjoy  :)

TSJ usually does the trick for me if I'm looking for a quick fix at lunch.  While it's definitely not high brow, I have no complaints about anything here.  It's a small place, but bright and inviting. I really like the fresh chips that came with the salsa.  The carne asada tacos are pretty good, and I enjoy the small, diced nature of the meat.  FYI, it comes with onions and cilantro, which this muchacho is ok with. The al pastor tacos are ok. My friend once ordered a ridiculous torta that came with (in order of importance) - steak, bacon, ham, and hot dog.  Well, that's how I would rank them in order of importance.  He says it was pretty good, so I'll have to take his word for it. So, to wrap up, when you have that regular craving of a torta filled with steak, bacon, ham, and hot dog, get at me cause I got a recommendation for you.  I'll have to try the nachos everyone raves about someday.  Plus, it's BYOB!

We were in the neighborhood and just had to stop by again for a tasty torta at San Jose.  I was happy to deviate from the original plan and try out the sopes!  The chicken was my favorite because it was seasoned well and had a fresh toppings and really good cheese!  In a close second were the other two: the "al pastor" and potato sopes.  Stop off at Taqueria San Jose next time you want an authentic sope, just make sure to get all the ingredients on them:  beans, meat, fresh tomato, grated cheese and cream with guacamole.

This is the place I order from when I want cheap, fast and fatty Mexican food. When we were too lazy to trek out into the cold, the said they delivered!  Oh boy...that makes a hungry girl very happy.  I love their steak tortas and horchata...why can't I find horchata in NY? Pisses me off to no extent!!!
Great food at reasonable prices.  We have been going here for years when we want Mexican food.  Breakfast is awesome and you don't leave hungry.

Been going to Taqueria San Jose for many years and really have no complaints.  It's pretty good food, at decent prices.  My go to meal here are the tortas.  They haven't let me down yet.  The tacos are ok, nothing to write home about.  On my most recent trip, I tried their sopes and I really really liked them..they may have to be added to the heavy rotation list - I had a Sope de Papa (mashed potatoes) and a Sope de Picadillo (ground beef) - the sope itself was crispy yet soft - this is key.  I have an issue with restaurants that serve rock hard sopes - not good at all.  These, were very yummy.  The mashed potatoes were seasoned nicely - also key.  Some places that make mashed potato dishes serve them with too little spices, these were nicely spiced - with a nice kick!  The picadillo was your typical picadillo - pretty good.  Both piled with beans, guacamole, sour cream, lettuce, tomato and sprinkled with cheese...  damn, now I'm hungry and no where near Taqueria San Jose. Credit card minimums yes, but I remember for years when they didn't accept cards at all and THAT was more of a pain in the rear, so the fact that they take them at all is a step up in my book. Underwhelming atmosphere, so definitely not 5 star dining, but for my purposes, a can't miss casual Mexican BYOB restaurant in the heart of Bridgeport.

About time I reviewed Taqueria San Jose... as this is my go-to neighborhood lunch/dinner/late-night/whatever joint for tasty Mexican food.  I love, with all my heart, Taqueria San Jose.  My only advice is: if you are looking for authentic Mexican food, do not be afraid to ask for onions & cilantro, etc. Taqueria San Jose is a little more "Americanized" than what I would prefer, but hey, that is just me.   Bringing up my avocado allergy again, Taqueria San Jose has never, ever, ever put avocado on my vegetarian burritos. Without fail. Hooray! I stopped in once late in the evening to try these nachos everyone is talking about... & oh yeah, they were right. Go ahead & order a rice milk... go ahead... get the large... the cup looks as big as my head but heck, Taqueria San Jose makes their horchata fresh & in-house.  Did I mention this place is BYOB? ;)

just moved near the area with my beau and thought we'd check out San Jose... I'd been there once before with a mexican so you'd think if mexicans go there it must be legit. I don't remember it being as gross as it was going with my beau... but then again I hadn't been living in Pilsen yet, the mecca of authentic mexican food in Chicago.... and I didn't know then that that mexican I went with was half white either. my beau eats almost 100% of the time camarones a la diabla whenever he sees it on a mexican menu... regardless if the mexican restaurant has a pop music centric jukebox or is showcasing "COPS" on their flat screen tvs. let me just tell you.... never eat any seafood at a place that plays "COPS" or "AMERICA'S DUMBEST CRIMINALS" during an evening dinner at full volume. If you must the burrito suizo is a safe haven...  and my polish/italian mother makes better guacamole... let it be known my mother is the type that thinks guacamole is  spanish for simply "mashed up avocados in a bowl" annndd I'm pretty sure I witnessed a single mom putting horchata in her babies bottle.

I have lived in Bridgeport for 6 months now and had never been here. Man O Man, I love my people I swear. I ordered tacos de carne asada(steak)  and tacos de pollo(chicken). They were both so good and juicy they come with cebolla y cilantro. Out of the two, I really liked the chicken but the steak was good too. Awesome, next time imma try the burrito. Looking for good mexican food in bridgeport, Here you Go!!!

This place isn't awful. But things are spicy when they shouldn't be. And the corn tortillas seem chewier than usual. And the Jamaica could be wayyy better. And the steak quesadilla is horrifying - it was 90% grease. And one time they brought us chips without us asking and then charged us for them - not cool. Basically, Erendira (which is right down the street) is much better. La Mexicana on 35th is better too, though not as good as Erendira. (But hey, thanks for being open until 4am.)
their super nachos is a must try ! other then that, i would say the food is just average... good thing about San Jose is that it opens late when other places is closed..

the world is over. i have found my favorite hole in the wall mexican joint. get over maxwells and get to san jose! i blame my boyfriend for my newfound super nacho addiction. we both hateeeee driving but we are ALWAYS willing to drive a mile or so for super nachos!!! it surprises me how simple san jose nachos are. yet, it bursts with so much flavor in your mouth! i always get the steak nachos. nachos topped with refried beans, steak and cheese. yup! that's it! chicken is also very good. steak is my number one choice here. and it's super cheap. it looks very "ghetto" and i read this place is byob. i give it 5 stars for just the nachos. a 1 star for the restaurant location and the look of the restaurant. ghetto restaurant in a ghetto neighborhood. but isn't that where all the good food is at???  so overall, i gave it a 5 star review because the nachos wins over anything else. :)

In the midst of running errands with my sister, I was craving mexican food. Some place close to home and a friend referral, I parked my car in front of this restaurant. I didn't know what to expect but said it was good. My sister ordered a steak burrito and regular size horchata. I ordered 2 steak tacos and a breaded steak torta with a reg size horchata. When we got home, my sister was confused at what she ordered. We paid for a reg size, but it looked like a king! Unless that is the reg size. haha. I forgot to order onions and cilantro with my tacos and got lettuce and tomatoes. Horchata is very flavorful, and instead of breaded steak torta, i got the regular steak torta. Although the order was wrong, it was still good! They gave me both green and red salsa. Now.. I would like to go back and dine there for the free chips and salsa. Great places exist in my neighborhood and gas is getting expensive.. Guess where I'll be going next?

I heart Mexican food like no other and when I'm super tired and not interested in having my boogers freeze outside, delivery is sweeeet. I called Taqueria where the lady answering rudely put me on hold for about 3-5 minutes. When she finally took my order, I asked when the food would be there. She didn't know and abruptly said there was an order before me so she didn't want to give me a time. The steak was a bit mealy and dry and the only saving grace was that i loaded it up with their red salsa. My roommate had the chicken and wasn't too happy with hers. The horchata tastes like liquid vanilla ice cream--ridiculously sweet. Rude service and meh food = nothx.

Big, big fan.  Get bombed at the Sox game, then go here.   Carne asada or al pastor burritos are among the best I've had in the city.  They're just the right size, whereas burritos are often obnoxiously big.  Great prices, never crowded, and the tubs of pickled jalapenos and carrots have the cure for the daily blues.   Sentimental points as I stopped here the night the Sox won the World Series.

Went there on Friday night and order the 2 tostadas plate- 1 steak, 1 pork. Both very flavorful and tender. Piled high with avocados, sour cream, and covered entirely in shredded cheese. I didn't care for the rice and beans. However, the salsa that they do serve with chips (when eating in), was delish. For 3 adults, the bill came out to be a few cents over $18. Definitely a great place for some authentic Mexican food. without breaking the bank!

Carne Asada tacos, Al pastor tacos, banana milk shake, and a piece of flan is all you need to enjoy this around the clock local joint.  Living in Bridgeport gives me multiple Mexican options but this one is a fair staple if you just want no frills quick food.

Get the Al Pastor tacos. They are great. I grew up in SoCal and these are the third best I have ever had. I wasted my time eating the lengua, which was terrible, the carne asada, which was barely average, and the menudo, which was not all that good. But the Pastor was awesome, we ordered 5 extras and just didn't bother to finish eating the other stuff.

Yesterday was just BAD. Like a Friday the 13th - minus Jason (thank God) Let's say it was more like a sit-com remake of the movie. Less drama, more triviality. My dry eyes need extra medication, nobody was available to have lunch with me, I was totally unable to focus on my work, my dog was just intoxicating me (furrealz, dude...) and I was out of milk for my cereal. Still bad enough, right? So I decided at night after a killer workout orchestrated by the maniac JM that some tacos al pastor were in order. Carbs+pork+a touch of sweetness+hot sauce = bliss Equation proved accurate times and times again. Taqueria San Jose does the job just right. A tacos dinner will cost you around $7 and will satisfy even the most irritated "mujer al borde de un ataque de nervios" (that's me, Almodovar style). Onions, cilantro, juicy and flavorful meat, slightly charred, warm tortillas, beans, rice, salad. Green and red salsa come on the table in squeeze-me bottles. Careful though: - the tortilla chips are super greasy - the TV program is quite unstable on a sports night and keep changing from baseball (White Sox) to basketball (Bulls) to baseball (Cubs) according to the customers' wishes. Disturbing, but not enough to stop me in my recovery dinner. Good place to refuel. Far enough from everything else for me to show up in sports gear, still sweaty from my intensive session of kickboxing. Please don't ewww. You would do the same.
Best chicken burrito! I recommend the dinner which comes with beans, rice, and guac..... Can't beat it!

Wow.  At first I wasn't going to write a review because I see so man but you know, I think it's always good to give your won experiences because you never know if someone is ordering exactly what you ordered, how you ordered it...  So here's my experience.   The Guacamole was very good.  The chips very fresh and the salsa and sauces were very good.   The last two times I went there, I first had a chicken burrito with everything but cheese...and then asked them to add onions and cilantro to the burrito.  They did so  and I truly enjoyed.   The last time I went, I had the chicken taco dinner.  I ordered with tomato, lettuce, onions, cheese and cilantro on flour tortillas.  It was very yummy.  The rice was tasty and the beans were yummy too.   Simple, good and delicious food.  I can't wait to go back!

This is by far my favorite burrito restaurant in town, and to be sure, I've been to quite a few of them. How could something like a classic bean burrito get any better? Well, they use carrots and other less common veggies in the recipe, and the refried beans are cooked a little longer so as to be a bit crunchy and chewy. That is, the burrito doesn't come out as a exploding mess. I love this place. The dining atmosphere is good, and the price is on the lower end of what you'd expect to pay. A definite must if you need a burrito!

The carne asada tacos are totally awesome!  The 3 taco dinner entree comes with rice and refried beans too.  The beans are actually one of the best I've had, they are surprisingly flavorful.  Back to the tacos... you can get them with lettuce, cheese and tomatoes, or you can opt for the onions and cilantro, which is what I do. Add one of their green or red salsas and it's good to go! oh and they have a really good horchata too, not too cinnamony...

2 words: Al Pastor. When my lil' bro told me he'd show me around (for once) and open my eyes to a new gastronomic world (for once), I didn't believe him. Well, let me tell you, I may not be a Mexican food expert but living in Chicago and eating at anywhere from taco joints to fancy Mexican restaurants, with the Maxwell street Market stands somewhere in between, I can tell you I've never had better Taco Al Pastor for that price.  +onion and cilantro and lime as a previous review mentions.

Wow, i was just let down by Yelp.  Perhaps they need a way to distinguish between late night drunken reviews and day reviews, because Taqueria San Jose was marginally average at best.  I can think of dozens of better taco shops all over the city as well, so i was really disappointed after seeing the 4 star rating and then eating here. Ok, best thing about the meal was the gigantic fresh orange juice I had.  I love fresh OJ, and they had a juicer up front.  Good stuff.   Second best thing about the meal, the chips and salsa.  The chips were freshly made and their red and green salsa's were both fairly tasty. ANd the owrst thing about the meal was the tacos.  If you can't make good tacos, i don't care how good anything else is, you can't call yourself a #1 Taqueria.  I had the Lengua, Carne Asada, Chille Relleno and Trippa tacos (one of each).  I didn't want to drown out the flavors, when i was ordering, so i went with the onion and cilantro topping instead of the mounds of cream, avocado and cheese that the neighboring table had gotten.  This was my mistake clearly, because those tacos needed drowning. Lengua - was a thin slice of tongue laid out on the taco.  It had no flavoring and was completely devoid of taste.  I had to check that it had not fallen out of the taco after my first bite.  It hadn't, it was just tasteless. Carne Asada - Tiny chunks of fried steak, that were greasy and unappealing. Chille Relleno - The cheese definietly helped this taco out, becuase it was the best of the bunch.  It didn't really work as a taco though.  I like Chille Rellenos, but apparently not on a taco.   Trippe - They fried the tripe and it tasted like dirty leather.  Yes, i know where the stuff comes from in the body, but that is no excuse.  I doused this sucker in lime juice and salsa and i still had to spit it out. This meal was a total waste of calories.  I knew i should have gone for a hot dog at 35th St dogs instead... Carne Asada - greasy small chuinks of steak

Thank you San Jose for introducing me to Mexican food and sustaining me throughout my 5 years of college at IIT! So dependably good, San Jose was a part of my weekly food budget! The vegetarian burrito (with everything = sour cream and cheese too!) has made me never want a burrito without beans and rice again!  The burrito with guacamole and horcata makes for a complete meal at any hour of the day. The food always comes with free spicy vegetables too....basically I think they are carrots, onions and other veggies marinated in jalapeños!  I ate here weekly from 2001-2008, #1 Mexican place in Bridgeport!

Man what happened to this place.  When I used to live a block away I would grab carry out from here quite often. Ive since moved a bit further away, (Chinatown area) not far but its no longer the convenient walk it used to be. So after a couple years of forgetting about San Jose I got a craving and decided to order from em again.  I got the food home, opened the styrofoam boxes and my tacos looked different. They looked, less generously stuffed. Wimpy even. And....DRY. wtf dry? Where is the glistening, greasy, shiny just off the hot plate appeal they used to have. Ditto for the onions. And the tortillas. They looked cold and lifeless. Fail. And yah, they tasted how they looked. I was able to offset the dryness by dunking them in my hot sauce. I also ordered a slice of 'tres leches' cake. This was the suck too. Like sawdust soaked in condensed milk. You cant hide a stale cake no matter how much its soaked dammit. Man, what happened to this place.

Open late when I need it and probably the best(only) thing to get in Bridgeport at 2am on the weekend. Their burritos are a big portion and in my to-go order they throw in a sack of pickled carrots! Now while I don't always use them to adorn my burrito, I save them for adding some pizzaz to my home cooked meals. I see cops around here often so that's a good sign. Chicago's finest know what's hot and what's not.

Thank God for TSJ!  I was one starvin' Marvin last night after a festive yelp event and stellar planetarium after hours party... get it? Stellar? PS- I'm totally retelling this joke in my planetarium review so don't get sick of it yet.  First off, I have to give it up to Carol K, who has once again saved me from going hungry with her knowledge of the Bridgeport area and all around impeccable taste. Thanks, Carol- forever and always!  The bf and I go in and it's just us, the super cute girl behind the counter, and the cook who's eating his dinner. We sit down and the girl, who is also the server promptly comes to bring us water, spicy delicious carrots, peppers, and onions, and takes our order. Now, we were both hungry so between the 2 of us we got 4 tacos and 2 burritos... and I have no regrets about consuming this most unhealthy meal. I finished every scrumptious calorie on my wax paper and in my aluminum foil and I'm happier man, er, woman because of it. The veggie food was good and I'll defo be back but I would have liked some cilantro or other yumminess on my veggie tacos like the meat ones my bf ordered had. Sadly, my veggie ones just had shredded lettuce, wah, wah. At least next time (which will be very soon) I'll know to ask if I can sub lettuce for cilantro and gives this place the 5 star bump.  Ooh... and if you're in need of a good pairing to go with TSJ, I would recommend starting the night out at Bernice's Tavern across the street, getting good and schwasted, then stumbling over to TSJ to refuel. 5 star night, guaranteed.

Dude, dude, dude. Rather delicious. The salsa was absolutely delicious to start. It was the perfect blend of smoky, spicy, and chunky. The chips were thick and greasy- not my typical preference but there helped cut some of the salsa spice so rock on. It was spicy enough that I kept shoveling it into my mouth before it caught up to me. (Not the spiciest ever, but you get the point). I had the carne asada tacos which were pretty tasty themselves. The corn tortillas had a good flavor as did the meat. Produce was a little sad looking but the meat made up for it. Oh and did I mention the side of avocado that was 35 cents and came out as a giant plate of avocado slices. There had to have been at least 1 if not 2 avocados on the plate. Which I kinda don't get cause they're more than that at the store, but whatev. I really can't complain about anything from this experience. Good food for cheap as hell, yes please.

I have been eating at this place since the FIRST owner owned the place. I think now it's on the third or 4th owner. Anyway, in the beginning, it was a small quick taco place. They remodeled and evolved to what they are now. This is a great, cheap priced Mexican restaurant. My Sister in Law and Brother in law came to visit all the way from Peru' and San Jose' was their very first EVER Mexican food they ever ate. They loved, LOVED it. I reccomend the SuperBurrito dinner. I also reccomend the taco dinner and everything else on the Menu. No alcohol? no problem. The place is also b.y.o.b. Very nice hangout after Friday night, Saturday night clubbing. Bernice's tavern in directly accross the street. Usually lots of the customers are regulars , like myself, and 9 times out of ten, everyone there from workers, and customers know each other personally. It's like a cool little family reunion every weekend. Go there. This place is extremely nice and reasonable. Being a Bridgeporter all my life, I highly reccomend Taqueria San Jose'.

I don't understand how people are writing bad reviews of this place. I think they must be confused.  Everything is good (drunk or sober). Everything is the right level of spicy. The service is excellent, and the only time they EVER messed up my order was the time they accidentally gave me three tacos instead of two.

I wish there were more Mexican places in Bridgeport. I had enchiladas and a taco from this place the other night and they were just ok. I'm use to having the meats of the enchiladas wrapped around the meat and stuff with cheese. This place was lazy and decided to cover the tortillas in the mole sauce and lay the meat on top with a meager portion of melted cheese. The taco was pretty good but I wish it had more flavor. My meal also came with rice and what they consider a salad, it was basically chopped up iceberg with a slice of tomato. The salad and rice were totally tasteless. Maybe next time I go I'll try the OJ that everyone is raving about.

Oh man, the fresh juice here is to die for! You can get all kinds, from orange, to carrot, to beet. Not that I'm having any beet juice, but hey, to each his own. Plus you can mix and match. A GIANT cup will run you five bucks. It's so refreshing. I've been eating here for a while, and my tried and true is the torta de milanesa, a breaded steak sandwich. It's super tasty. I always get an order of the cebollitas as well, which is fried spring onions with a few jalapenos. So far this place has been pretty spot on. Except yesterday. I strayed from the norm and got a regular steak torta. The meat was good, but everything else pretty much sucked. The bread was kind of stale, and the toppings pretty much turned to mush, for some reason. I'll be back though, I think it was just an off day. Oh, and this place is BYOB. So grab a six pack of Pacifico and dig in. Good cheap eats, and the service is pretty good.
Weak.  Tacos Erendira is so much better and only 20 yards away.

I love this place. I have been coming here for a couple of years. It beats all other Mexican places in the area. Great drunk food, great lunch food, just great food.
