They recently got tv's, a juicer, SOPES!!!, and now it's BYOB. Their tacos are awesome. I usually get chicken, steak, ciccina (dried beef). The rice and beans are also good. Their chips and guac really stand out though. I am pretty sure the chips are homemade. This place serves some great food at a great price. The staff is also really nice. I have never had a problem here. Highly recommended.

O my gooodnesssss. They bought a juicer! Where else can you get a HUGE HUGE cup of fresh yummy OJ for $5 bucks. It is such a rip off when you go to breakfast places and they charge you $4 bucks for OJ that you take 2 sips out of and finish...so that being said, the cups are big and the juice yummy. they also juice carrots and beets and such.... =)

I'd give this place 4/5 on the scale of Chicago taco joints, but It's a travesty that Taqueria San Jose (as of this writing) has a lower rating than its next-door neighbor, Tacos Erendia.  I've been to both, but only return to TSJ, usually for tacos al pastor (onion and cilantro only, gringos!) and the excellent horchata, maybe with cebollitas and queso fundido con chorizo.   Ryan B. has the right idea -- this is a greasy, cheap, delicious taqueria.

I decided to try the chicken tacos because this place is near my work and I'm always up for some Mexican food. The chicken tacos weren't bad but definitely not the best I've ever had. I got them with tomato, sour cream, and onion and cilantro like everyone suggested. The mixture didn't have very much flavor which I was actually ok with because I'm not huge on raw onion. I would probably try it again because it's cheap but I wasn't overly impressed.
The best Al Pastor (pork) tacos in town (make sure you get the tacos with onion and cilantro and ask for lime too). It's pretty cheap and it never fails.

There are two Mexican restaurants virtually next door to each other near 32nd and Halsted, and they offer food that is delicious in completely different ways. Taqueria San Jose is the greasy, delicious cousin of Tacos Erindira: they both hit the spot in different ways, whatever mood my complex Mexican cravings decides to be in. San Jose serves up decent-sized yummy burritos really quick.  I'd also highly recommend the quesadillas: unlike the Taco Bell'd versions you get at most Mexican fast food places, this restaurant serves them up with Mexican cheese just barely melted on an open tortilla, with lettuce, tomatoes and avocadoes (if you are lucky).  Two of them make the perfect late night snack. The cebollitas are also something of a unique addition to the late-night Mexican grubbage experience.  Definitely give them a try!

Can I really love a Burrito joint?  I guess I can cuz I'm crazy about this place. The carne asada burrito is huge, delicious and exactly what I needed to fill my tummy the other night.  We just popped in for some take out but the place was clean (even the bathroom was spotless and had one of those padded toilet seats that always make me laugh!), the prices reasonable and the the food?  The real star of the night. A friend has been raving about this place for some time.  Now I finally get what he's been saying.  Open late.  Open early.  Check it out.

The place is clean and open late. I actually eat lunch here on occasion, so this is not a drunken sailor review of a burrito joint. Everything is good here especially the Carne asada burritos. Get a side order of Cebollitas(Grilled Green Onions) and add an order of guacamole. You get the picture. Enjoy!

Been going here since i was a wee lad. Everything is always good, delivery takes like 17 minutes to get to house, what else can you ask for? Super nachos (steak, or ground beef) and a Cubana (a.k.a. ; heart attack special)  and your full for two days. Did i mention there open to the ass crack everyday?

Great little taqueria.  The pork super burrito is probably my favorite.  The green sauce is great and spicy.  I was surprised by the queso fundido with chorizo.  Much better than at some "fancier" mexican restaurants.  They do deliver, but have never taken advantage of it as this place is 50 ft from my door.

Your basic late-night burrito joint.  The food is good, and the service is quick.  Can't really complain, but also not really raving about it.  It's great to have something like this in walking distance though!
Best Mexican in a neighborhood with a lot of different options.  Good for dine-in, carryout, or delivery.  Nothing fancy.   EDIT:  I recently noticed that they put a BYO sign in the window.  Profit!
Typical joint. It's open late and close to home. I always get the vegetarian burrito with no cheese and no sour cream, and it's good. Especially when I'm drunk.

About as cheap as tacos get.  Steak has nice flavor.  I only get onions and cilantro but lettuce and tomatoes were offered.     A little home-tied baggie filled with pickled carrots comes with your to-go order.  Nice touch!  First time I've ever seen that.

I usually just get the carne asada burrito. It's good and filling.  When I'm in the mood for Mexican and something quick....this is usually where we go.  I see people talking about the chicken tacos. I'm going to have to try it out next time.

The best greasy taqueria food for the price i've had in Chicago, let alone Bridgeport, and I eat greasy taqueria food about as often as I can.  $1.40 chicken tacos can't be beat when the chicken is this moist and delicious.  The carne asada is decent, or not as bad as Nicolas' friends seem to think at least.  I love the al pastor stuff, but friends have told me I'm crazy -- odds are good they're wrong though.  It's really good.   Oh, and the guacamole is really inconsistent -- sometimes it's heavy on the onions and cilantro, sometimes it's mostly tomato, other times it's a more even blend -- but always really good.  The salsa you get as a side dish sucks though.  It has the look of a blended mix of all the (delicious) rojo and verdes they couldn't sell last week with some old cilantro and onions thrown in for good measure.  And they used to just give you El Ranchero chips out of the bag, but they've recently switched to making their own, and, oddly enough, it's a step backwards.  Oh yeah, really good horchata, too.   The 4am closing time is only on weekends and always at their discretion, by the way.  They've closed as early as 1 on weekends and 11 (posted closing time for every night of the week) on weeknights.

I've a vegetarian and only order one thing (the vegetarian burrito), but oh is it delicious. They're super-fast, super-consistent, super-friendly and their in-house ATM only charges $1.50 for transactions. Friends have told me that a carne asada anything here sux, though. The chicken is what they rave about.

I think their milanesa tortas are divine.  I've been here like 50 times and have yet to have a bad experience.  good chicken tacos too.  In fact I'll have to get that next time I go.  I used to get their burritos but they're too much for me these days!  Way better than erendira down the street or pancho's imo.

Standard Mexican food.  Tastes pretty damn good to me, especially at 4am when you are hammered with only $4 and there is a 10 piece Mariachi Band playing...  Not worth a drive to check it out or anything, but if you live in the hood you should definitely be eating here.  (Skip the steak tacos, the chicken is where it's at.)

Really great chicken tacos.  The pork and steak are excellent, too.  Onion and cilantro, double corn tortillas, just the perfect amount of spice and grease.  I didn't try anything else this time around, just stopped in and picked up a light dinner.   This would be a solid 3.5 stars but the chicken tacos took it over the edge to 4.  The girl at the counter was very nice, the food prepared quickly.  Great find!

This is one of the worst restaurant experiences I think I've ever had. A co-worker and I ordered from them for lunch.  1.5 - 2 hours after placing the order, it still hadn't arrived; we called and were told that the delivery person wasn't able to get into the building, and that when they called no one answered. Turns out the girl who took the order wrote down the wrong telephone number. In addition, while the building we're in has a secured area, our office is immediately inside the door and open to all who enter the building. We asked them to deliver our food again, and this time actually come into the office; however, we asked them to re-make the nachos my co-worker had ordered, as she knew they would be soggy after so long. When they returned, the deliverman called before he arrived, so I was waiting outside for him. When we opened our food, it was of course cold, but they hadn't re-made the nachos. They were soggy, which was bad enough, but it looked like they had just taken some chips and dumped refried beans on top. Not appetizing at all. I know that we'll never eat at this restaurant again. It's too bad, because the burrito probably would have been pretty good if it wasn't lukewarm.

Best chicken tacos I have ever had.  They have perfected the ratio of meat to onion to cilantro. Their staff is so nice, however can forget to be attentive to your needs.  They are a much better at take out and delivery

I love this little taqueria in bridgeport it's open until 4 am and im a big fanatic about places that open late i've had the best milkshakes here and the best enchiladas here as well. althought the menu isn't very extensive its a great late night place when your finished getting drunk at the bars or just had to work until 2 in the morning and nothing else is open plus mexican always seems the way to be after youve had one to many drinks

It's the closest joint still open past ten that I can walk to in 5 minutes or less. The restaurant is very clean, a little chilly inside, and reminds me of my father-in-law's old restaurant with the whole family helping out. We usually order guac and picadillo tacos, which are always just OK, but way better than having to cook when you're tired and can't stand the thought of slaving in the kitchen for an hour.
